description: The shards command is the detailed view of what nodes contain which shards. It will tell you if it’s a primary or replica, the number of docs, the bytes it takes on disk, and the node where it’s located.

targets.expr: max(increase(elasticsearch_cat_shards_indexing_index_time_seconds{cluster=~"$cluster", index=~"$index", shard=~"$shard"}[$time]) / increase(elasticsearch_cat_shards_indexing_index_current{cluster=~"$cluster", index=~"$index", shard=~"$shard"}[$time])) by (shard, index)

max(increase(elasticsearch_cat_shards_flush_total_time_seconds{cluster=~"$cluster", index=~"$index", shard=~"$shard"}[$time]) / increase(elasticsearch_cat_shards_flush_total{cluster=~"$cluster", index=~"$index", shard=~"$shard"}[$time])) by (shard, index)

max(increase(elasticsearch_cat_shards_indexing_delete_time_seconds{cluster=~"$cluster", index=~"$index", shard=~"$shard"}[$time])  / increase(elasticsearch_cat_shards_indexing_delete_total{cluster=~"$cluster", index=~"$index", shard=~"$shard"}[$time])) by (shard, index)

max(increase(elasticsearch_cat_shards_merges_total_time_seconds{cluster=~"$cluster", index=~"$index", shard=~"$shard"}[$time]) / max(increase(elasticsearch_cat_shards_merges_total{cluster=~"$cluster", index=~"$index", shard=~"$shard"}[$time])) by (shard, index)

panels.description:
Store size of shard (how much disk it uses)

https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/cat-shards.html#cat-shards-api-query-params
panels.title: Shard store size

targets.expr: max(increase(elasticsearch_cat_shards_warmer_total_time_seconds{cluster=~"$cluster", index=~"$index", shard=~"$shard"}[$time]) / increase(elasticsearch_cat_shards_warmer_total{cluster=~"$cluster", index=~"$index", shard=~"$shard"}[$time])) by (shard, index)

max(increase(elasticsearch_cat_shards_refresh_external_time_seconds{cluster=~"$cluster", index=~"$index", shard=~"$shard"}[$time]) / increase(elasticsearch_cat_shards_refresh_total{cluster=~"$cluster", index=~"$index", shard=~"$shard"}[$time])) by (shard, index)

max(increase(elasticsearch_cat_shards_refresh_time_seconds{cluster=~"$cluster", index=~"$index", shard=~"$shard"}[$time]) / increase(elasticsearch_cat_shards_refresh_total{cluster=~"$cluster", index=~"$index", shard=~"$shard"}[$time])) by (shard, index)

max(increase(elasticsearch_cat_shards_search_query_time_seconds{cluster=~"$cluster", index=~"$index", shard=~"$shard"}[$time]) / increase(elasticsearch_cat_shards_search_query_total{cluster=~"$cluster", index=~"$index", shard=~"$shard"}[$time])) by (shard, index)

max(increase(elasticsearch_cat_shards_search_fetch_time_seconds{cluster=~"$cluster", index=~"$index", shard=~"$shard"}[$time]) / increase(elasticsearch_cat_shards_search_fetch_total{cluster=~"$cluster", index=~"$index", shard=~"$shard"}[$time])) by (shard, index)

panels.description:
Memory used by fixed bit sets for nested object field types and type filters for types referred in _parent fields

https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/cat-shards.html#cat-shards-api-query-params
panels.title: Shard segments fixed bitset memory

title: Elasticsearch Exporter: /_cat/shards
